p: Yatein was isolated from Chamaecyparis obtuse (Cupressaceae). It could significantly suppress HSV-1 replication in HeLa cells without apparent cytotoxicity [ 37]. MOA showed that yatein can inhibit HSV-1 alpha gene expression, including the expression of the ICP0 and ICP4 genes, by arresting HSV-1 DNA synthesis and structural protein expression in HeLa cells [ 38].
